image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 8 extrajudicial killings in first 52 days of Bangladesh interim government
item.description: Odhikar, a Bangladeshi human rights organization, reports eight extrajudicial killings following the interim government's rise to power on August 8. Their July-September report also documents 52 deaths and 1,308 injuries from political violence, including 31 lynchings, between August 9 and September 30. These figures follow the student-led uprising that resulted in 1,581 deaths and over 18,000 injuries.

item.title: Dhaka: Not enough support from China, India on Rohingyas
Xi Jinping seizes role as global defender of free trade
North Korea deploys a new weapon against the South: Unbearable noise
Slash first, fix later: How Elon Musk prefers to cut costs
7 Pakistan soldiers killed in border post attack
Xi signals cooperation with Trump in final meeting with Biden
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping and outgoing US President Joe Biden met at the Apec forum in Peru, emphasizing the importance of stable US-China relations. Xi expressed willingness to cooperate with the incoming Trump administration despite campaign promises that have raised concerns in Beijing.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump picks oil firm CEO Chris Wright as energy secretary
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump has tapped Chris Wright, a fossil fuel executive and campaign donor, to lead the Energy Department in his second term. Wright, CEO of Liberty Energy, is a staunch advocate for oil and gas development, including fracking, aligning with Trump's goal of achieving U.S. energy dominance.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Democrat Wasserman Schultz calls Tulsi Gabbard a 'Russian asset,' sparking widespread backlash
item.description: Florida Representative Debbie Wasserman Schultz has ignited controversy by accusing Tulsi Gabbard, President-elect Trump's nominee for Director of National Intelligence, of being a "Russian asset." This accusation, made without evidence, has drawn sharp criticism from commentators who point to Wasserman Schultz's own past controversies, including her handling of the Imran Awan IT scandal and the debunked Russian dossier.

item.title: Could Prince Harry inherit the throne? Nostradamus prediction suggests it's possible
item.description: A new interpretation of Nostradamus's prophecies by Mario Reading suggests that King Charles's reign might be short-lived. Reading speculates that public disapproval stemming from King Charles's past divorce could lead to abdication, paving the way for an unexpected heir.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Is Biden taller than Trump? White House photo sparks height discussions on social media
item.description: President Joe Biden's recent cheerful demeanor, particularly during his meeting with Donald Trump at the White House, has sparked online discussions. A photo from the meeting, where Biden appears taller than Trump despite official records indicating otherwise, has fueled speculation and conspiracy theories.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Anti-Christian bigotry': JD Vance calls out news agency AP for 'attacking' Pete Hegseth over controversial tattoo
item.description: JD Vance has accused the Associated Press (AP) of 'anti-Christian bigotry' for a report focusing on a tattoo worn by Pete Hegseth, Donald Trump's pick for defense secretary. The tattoo, 'Deus Vult,' is a Christian motto that has also been adopted by some white supremacist groups. The AP previously retracted an article about Vance in July.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'We need a British Trump': Former UK PM Elizabeth Truss calls for bold reforms
item.description: At the HT Leadership Summit 2024, former UK Prime Minister Liz Truss called for a "British Trump" to drive significant change in the United Kingdom, emphasizing the need to reduce bureaucracy and forge stronger trade relationships with India and the US. Truss praised India's growing global influence and expressed optimism about the future of India-UK relations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Old video of Donald Trump showing off baby Barron Trump goes viral
item.description: A video of Donald Trump introducing his infant son, Barron, in 2007 has resurfaced online. In the video, Trump jokingly describes Barron with terms like "vicious" and "violent," highlighting the qualities of an entrepreneur. Now 18 years old and a student at NYU, Barron generally maintains a private life, unlike his siblings who were more public during Trump's presidency.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Famine in northern Gaza 'occurring or imminent', warn experts
item.description: The UN Security Council received dire warnings about a looming famine in northern Gaza due to Israel's month-long siege. While the US urged Israel against forcible displacement and starvation tactics, Israel refuted the famine claims, citing aid deliveries. However, the UN reported the lowest aid levels in the past month, raising concerns about a humanitarian catastrophe.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Southwest Airlines plane hit by bullet at Dallas airport
item.description: A Southwest Airlines flight bound for Indianapolis from Dallas Love Field experienced a shocking incident on Friday night. As the plane was preparing for takeoff, a bullet struck the aircraft near the flight deck. Thankfully, no injuries were reported among the passengers or crew. Law enforcement was immediately notified, and the plane was taken out of service for investigation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Gabon votes on new constitution hailed by junta as 'turning point'
item.description: Gabon is holding a referendum on a new constitution following the end of the Bongo dynasty after a coup. The proposed constitution limits presidential terms, eliminates the prime minister position, and prevents dynastic transfers of power. The vote is seen as a step towards civilian rule, with transitional President General Brice Oligui Nguema advocating for a 'yes' vote.

item.title: 'He may send me': Joe Biden jokes about going to space to rescue stranded ISS astronauts
item.description: During an APEC meeting, President Biden joked about his wife's threat to send him to space with Nasa Administrator Bill Nelson's help if he misbehaves. He linked his quip to the ongoing situation with stranded astronauts awaiting their return to Earth. Biden also acknowledged Peru's involvement in space exploration initiatives.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Prince Harry moves forward with lawsuit against Murdoch's NGN while most claimants settle
item.description: Prince Harry maintains his lawsuit against Rupert Murdoch's News Group Newspapers (NGN) over unlawful information gathering, despite other claimants settling. Harry alleges NGN targeted him for private information between 1996 and 2011. The trial is scheduled for January, where Harry's legal team will argue that senior figures at NGN were aware of and potentially involved in the unlawful activities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: $64,000 heist spree: Thieves target UPS and FedEx trucks in NYC, loot Gucci and Apple items
item.description: A string of robberies targeting UPS and FedEx delivery vehicles plagued New York City, spanning from April to November. A group of five masked thieves, sometimes working in smaller groups, made off with jewelry, electronics, designer goods, and other valuables exceeding $64,000 in total. Despite surveillance footage capturing the suspects, no arrests have been made.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
